unicode.value: This course will provide different material to write a film review.

¡Bienvenidos al curso de Film reviews! Aquí encontraras distintas
herramientas para poder escribir un review sobre tu película favorita. La idea principal
es reconocer las distintas partes y procesos que debemos seguir para escribirlo de
forma correcta, además encontraras vocabulario y estructuras para hacerlo más
atractivo.

Diariamente somos expuestos a distintos tipos de textos y muchas
veces al estudiar una lengua extranjera nos interiorizamos más en el tema. En este
caso, todos hemos visto alguna vez una película, ya sea buena o mala y para poder
compartir nuestra experiencia debemos saber cómo escribir un film review. Debemos
tener en cuenta que cada texto es diferente, necesitamos saber desde su estructura
hasta el lenguaje que debe ser utilizado.

• Promover la escritura en una lengua extranjera (inglés).
  • Brindar vocabulario y estructuras necesarias para el texto a producir.
  • Incentivar la escritura mediante películas, trailers, videos.
  • Expandir el conocimiento de los estudiantes.
  • Fomentar el pensamiento crítico.

El primer contenido a trabajar será los distintos tipos de películas que se pueden
encontrar, sus definiciones, ejemplos con videos, distintos materiales para la
exposición al tema. Luego se seguirá con un propio film review, en donde se trabajara
la estructura del mismo. Es decir, el título, la cantidad de párrafos, la información que
cada uno contiene y además el lenguaje utilizado para describir distintos aspectos que
debemos tener en cuenta cuando estamos escribiendo, por ej. Setting, acting,
soundtrack, etc. Por último se trabajara con la producción de un propio film review en
donde se deben utilizar todas las herramientas planteadas anteriormente.

To begin this unit we'll watch some trailers!

  • Have you seen these movies?
  • Do you know their type?
  • Do you know any other type of films?
Match the types of films with their definitions.

1. Documentary
  2. Western
  3. Action
  4. Science Fiction
  5. Adventure
  6. Musical
  7. Comedy

  1. In these films the heroes are pushed into a series of events that typically include violence, extended fighting, physical feats, and frantic chases.
  2. These films are like action films, but they take place in exotic places. They could be about pirates, historical adventures such as sailing around the world and space exploration.
  3. The focus is on humor. These films are made to make the audience laugh through amusement.
  4. This is a non-fictional film that investigates some real-life story. The objective is to instruct, educate, or maintain a historical record.
  5. These films use speculative, fictional science-based depictions. The most popular ones are about extraterrestrial lifeforms, alien worlds, time travel, robots or other technologies.
  6. These films are set mainly in the latter half of the 19th century in the Western United States. Its stories commonly center on the life of a cowboy or gunfighter armed with a revolver and a rifle who rides a horse.
  7. Music and songs by the characters are interwoven into the narrative, sometimes accompanied by dancing (e.g: Singin’ in the Rain, 1954).
Choose one word for each space from 1 to 9

Action/ based/ directed/ location/ recommend/ sequels/ set/ stars

CLASSIC FILMS YOU MUST SEE

The Godfather (1972)

The film The Godfather is based on the book by Mario Puzo. The film was 2 _________ by Francis Ford Coppola. It 3 ________ Marlon Brando as Vito Corleone and Al Pacino as his son, Michael. The film won three Oscars in 1973 for best actor (Marlon Brando), best movie and best screenplay.

The film is 4_________ in New York in the 1940s and 50s. It was filmed on 5__________ in New York and in Sicily.

The film is about the Corleone family. Vito, ‘The Godfather’ is the leader of one of the most powerful criminal families in America. Don Vito runs his business by doing favours and expecting favours in return. The Corleones get involved in a war with other criminal families, because they don’t want to sell drugs. Don Vito is shot and he is seriously injured. While Don Vito is in hospital, the control of the family passes to his eldest son, Sonny. Then, Don Vito’s youngest son, Michael returns home to do what he can to help the family. He also takes his revenge against the people who are trying to kill his father.

I strongly 6____________ The Godfather. It has 7____________ and drama and an important message: that violence never really solves anything. The two 9_____________, The Godfather II and The Godfather III are also good.
After reading The Godfather answer the questions:

1. What is the title of the film?
  2. Is it based on a book?
  3. Who is the director?
  4. Who are the stars of the film?
  5. Where is the film set?
  6. When is the film set?
  7. What is the film about?
  8. Which type of film is it?
In the following video you'll see the answers and explanations of the previous activities.
You have an extra activity!
To begin with this unit we'll see an example of film review.

Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom 

Have you ever been so passionate about something that you would sacrifice your very best years for it? Would you even put it ahead of your family and friends? In the film Mandela: Lond Walk to Freedom we get not only a glimpse of Nelson Mandela’s life, but rather dive deep into who he was and how he changed a whole country.

While the whole film captivated me throughout, there was one aspect that truly stood out to me. Nelson Mandela and his second wife Winnie had a one-of-a-kind relationship driving each other to continue and grow the anti-apartheid movement in South Africa even after Mr Mandela was captured and imprisoned. It is a testament to their dedication and partnership and something that a lot of us can learn from.

Despite having a strong and driven partner in his wife, I still used to be astonished by the fact that someone would simply sacrifice themselves and give up a big part of their life to help others, but this biopic made me reconsider. Witnessing a segregated society and all the racial abuse the black community had to endure during apartheid, there was no other option for Nelson Mandela than to stand up and fight for equality.

All in all, Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom gives some incredible insight into the life of one of the world’s most famous and influential personalities of the 20th century. It would be a shame not to watch it so I highly recommend that you check your favourite streaming service or buy the film as soon as you can and I promise you won’t regret it.
In this video we'll work with plenty of vocabulary.
Do the wordsearch and find different vocabulary!

Christina Latham-Koenig, Clive Oxenden “English file intermediate”
Virginia Evans “Successful wrting
